intro: Epipactis atrorubens subvar. radnensis, commonly known as the Radnënskaya helleborine, is a rare orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It is characterized by its dark reddish-brown flowers with a distinctive greenish throat and yellowish lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are elongated and often have a waxy coating, which helps in water retention. This orchid is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
